page.title: 08Caves in Minera Mountain
page.content: Because the mountain is mainly formed of limestone which is dissolved by acid water there are many caves and underground passages which stretch for miles.It is dangerous to explore these but there are two local potholing clubs whose members go down regularly wearing special safety equipment. Down in the underground passages it is pitch black and the temperature usually stays about 48 Farenheit.One of these caves is big enough to take our school with room to spare. Lead miners wrote their names in wet clay over a hundred years ago and this is perfectly preserved because there are no changes of weather. There are bats and other creatures in some of the caves but most creatures like to stay where there is some day light.
